dt: {bc}occurring over a wide geographic area (such as multiple countries or continents) and typically affecting a significant proportion of the {d_link|population|population}

dt.t: The 1918 flu was {wi}pandemic{/wi} and claimed millions of lives.

dt: {bc}characterized by very widespread growth or extent {bc}{sx|epidemic:1||3}

et: Greek {it}pándēmos{/it} "of all the people, public, common, (of diseases) widespread (in {et_link|galen|Galen:b})" (from {it}pan-{/it} {et_link|pan-|pan-} + {it}-dēmos,{/it} adjective derivative of {it}dêmos{/it} "district, country, people") + {et_link|-ic:1|-ic:1} {ma}{mat|demo-|}{/ma}
shortdef: occurring over a wide geographic area (such as multiple countries or continents) and typically affecting a significant proportion of the population
characterized by very widespread growth or extent : epidemic

dt: {bc}an outbreak of a disease that occurs over a wide geographic area (such as multiple countries or continents) and typically affects a significant proportion of the population {bc}a pandemic outbreak of a disease

dt.t: Influenza {wi}pandemics{/wi} seem to strike every few decades and to kill by the million—at least 1m in 1968; perhaps 100m in the {ldquo}Spanish{rdquo} flu of 1918-19.

dt: {bc}an outbreak or product of sudden rapid spread, growth, or development {bc}{sx|epidemic:2||2}

dt.t: We have been talking about the {wi}pandemic{/wi} of racism for centuries.
Nobel-prize winning economist Robert Shiller warns a {wi}pandemic{/wi} of fear could tip the economy into an undeserved depression.

quotes.t: In ten years that it raged, this {qword}pandemic{/qword} took or ravaged the lives of nearly five million people before it disappeared, as mysteriously and suddenly as it had arrived, in 1927.
There is evidence that this gambling {qword}pandemic{/qword} is going global.
… it also hopes to utilize this cultural investigation to better understand strategies to reduce the massive {qword}pandemic{/qword} we now understand cigarette smoking to produce.

… globalization, the most thoroughgoing socioeconomic upheaval since the Industrial Revolution, which has set off a {qword}pandemic{/qword} of retrogressive nationalism, regional separatism, and religious extremism.

shortdef: an outbreak of a disease that occurs over a wide geographic area (such as multiple countries or continents) and typically affects a significant proportion of the population : a pandemic outbreak of a disease
an outbreak or product of sudden rapid spread, growth, or development : epidemic
